text: Is holding public office more noble than making a success of one's self in private sector?  That becomes an issue on @toniforchicago v @LightfootForChi  race for mayor?
author: GregHinz

text: Beefcake!!!!
author: GregHinz

text: Ad battle begins over proposed graduated income tax as both sides make their case w paid spots.  It's @GovPritzker's "fair tax" dinging only the rich vs. foes' "Madigan plan" to eventually zap middle-income people too. Take a look
author: GregHinz

text: U.S. Senate bill takes aim at @CTA;s China el car deal.   Ban on using Chinese firms if fed $$$ is involved grandfather's current pact but could affect renewal and options, and hit @Metra as it seeks bidder for up to 600 new passenger cars.
author: GregHinz

text: nope, casten. but she now says she's not running
author: GregHinz

text: Today's mayoral endosements: @Chancetherapper for @toniforchicago , and downtown @AldReilly for @LightfootForChi.  Chance has a following, but Reilly's ward is the biggest in the city.  Who would you rather have on your side?
author: GregHinz

text: ok
author: GregHinz

text: why should 100 years of federal law be abruptly changed to give some states that pass their social costs on to the federal government while keeping their own taxes law a break over states that conveniently favor the other political party? pure partisan politcs
author: GregHinz

text: .@SeanCasten defends House record under Dem rule as potential GOP foes to his 2020 reelection start to circle. See what he says -- and who might run.
author: GregHinz

text: You first:  @GovPritzker sets high bar to fund @UofIResearch Discovery Partners Institute in South Loop, saying they'll have to raise $500M privately before he'll release state $$$.  Does this @RahmEmanuel idea still have a heart beat?
author: GregHinz

text: Grab your wallet: Plan to triple Chicago real-estate transfer tax gets big backing -- and 3.3% rate applies not just to "mansions" but many commercial sales.  See what @Metroplanners endorses.
author: GregHinz

text: Chicago getting non-stop service to Tel-Aviv.  @ELALUSA @fly2ohare @RahmEmanuel
author: GregHinz

text: Congressional split as @RepMikeQuigley backs @LightfootForChi for mayor, but @RepDannyDavis endorses @ToniPreckwinkle
author: GregHinz

text: .#STEM students would get free tuition and fees at Illinois public universities and schools if they agree to stick around and teach.  That's the proposal from @IMA_Today in pending Springfield bill.
author: GregHinz

text: A truce in the war between @CTA and @Uber, @Lyft et al?  City Hall panel says maybe -- but either @LightfootForChi or @toniforchicago will have to do the heavy lifting, and it won't come free.
author: GregHinz

text: And the @LightfootForChi bandwagon continues to pick up speed
author: GregHinz

text: Is the race for mayor over?   @LoriLightfoot emerges as the clear candidate to beat, but @toniforchicago has a way to close the gap -- maybe.  https://tinyurl.com/y4mfcv6n
author: GregHinz

text: Lease or sell the @ILTollway to finally get a handle on the state's alarming pension debt?  Former state Sen. @jeffschoenberg, ex-head of Ec & Fisc, writes why it might make sense.  Definitely worth a read.
author: GregHinz

text: well, let's not go overboard, Mr. Daniels.
author: GregHinz

text: .@LightfootForChi gets $100k in campaign cash from #MadisonDearborn's John Canning.  Is it a sign business is moving toward her at a critical time?
author: GregHinz

text: .@LightfootForChi endorsement by @ChicagoFireDept union a big deal for her, potentially very helpful in @joyce4mayor land on the NW and SW sides
author: GregHinz

text: Will @ToniPreckwinkle crush @LoriLightfoot with campaign ads?  Maybe not, as the latter pulls in $300k in one day, including $100,000 from Leslie Bluhm  https://tinyurl.com/y67wpbez
author: GregHinz

text: Who's the next mayor?  She who better presents herself as a agent of change as "progressive" @ToniPreckwinkle battles "reformer" @LightfootForChi
author: GregHinz

text: "The reformer" v. "the progressive";  @LightfootForChi and @ToniPreckwinkle wrestle to become THE change agent as the gloves come off in the mayoral runoff and biz determines whether to throw in with Lightfoot.  http://tinyurl.com/yxck9hcr
author: GregHinz

text: .#PlannedParenthood Chicago flexes some political muscle as  SIX Illinois House members show up at anti-"gag rule" presser.  See which third of the state's total delegation made it in.  @PPI action.
author: GregHinz

text: .@BernieSanders hits town Sunday for 7 p.m. rally at Navy Pier.  Is the old magic still alive this time?
author: GregHinz

text: .@LightfootForChi out w first runoff TV ad.  HIts both populist economic and political reform themes. Watch and judge yourself.  @toniforchicago
author: GregHinz

text: CTM, i'm wasting ink her, but you can't prove something didn't happen that didn't happen

text: U.S. House finally moves on guns -- and voters need to remember.   Daring steps by @@RepRobinKelly @SeanCasten, @RepMikeQuigley, @LaurenUnderwood, @RepChuyGarcia and others..   But the left needs to be as passionate as the right.
author: GregHinz

text: sounds like a time novak script.  :)
author: GregHinz

text: Take that, @JussieSmollett!  Chicago TV/film production remains hot, as #ChicagoFire et al renew, adn @cinespacechicag prepares to open second, satellite soundstage campus.  Good news for a change.
author: GregHinz

text: What's next in Chcago's wild and historic mayoral election?  Here's some things to watch -- both here and Springfield.  @LightfootForChi @ToniPreckwinkle @Cubs
author: GregHinz

text: i'll repeat: you explain to homeowners why their prop taxes will rise even more because someone gets a 3% annual compound COLA forever, even if inflation is much slower.
author: GregHinz

text: maybe cause he's right....without relief on the cost side, the price in higher taxes will be excruciating.  3% COLAs in era of 1% inflation = insolvency
author: GregHinz

text: .@DaleyForMayor concedes. It's over: @LightfootForChi v @ToniPreckwinkle for that big office on the 5th floor
author: GregHinz

text: good line, matt. i 'spect not.
author: GregHinz

text: march 12
author: GregHinz

text: .@DaleyForMayor needs a miracle -- or at least a couple of good ol' river wards. He's 5,400 behind @ToniPreckwinkle, who's 6,500 behind @LightfootForChi  with 85 percent of precincts in.
author: GregHinz

text: sens me some quotes, guys, when available.
author: GregHinz

text: just about everyone thought turnout would be very low david.  right about what specifically?
author: GregHinz

text: The mayoral is getting awfully close to being over, with @LightfootForChi's lead over @ToniPreckwinkle continuing to grow at 6k+ over @DaleyForMayor, and the latter 4k-plus behind her. Thank u #JerryJoyce!!!
author: GregHinz

text: don't know yet.  but very good question
author: GregHinz

text: Looks like runoff for sure in Lincoln Park, with @AldermanSmith43 at about 40%, and challenger @DerekLindblom at 28 percent. Everyone else trails well behind
author: GregHinz

text: The  mayoral trend is holding With two-thirds in now, it’s @LoriLightfoot with 62,276 (17.38%), @ToniPreckwinkle with 55,919 (15.61%) and @Daleyformahyor 53,193 (14.85%).  If it stays that tight look of lots of attention to the 20,000+ mail ballots that might yet come in
author: GregHinz

text: Embattled, and criminally charged, Ald. #EdBurke appears to be hanging in.  With half the precincts in, he has 53% -- enough to avoid a runoff if it holds
author: GregHinz

text: The hot 44th Ward aldermanic race, @AldTomTunney v. the @Cubs-owning Ricketts, appears to be over. With half the vote in, he has 63%
author: GregHinz

text: With half the vote in, it's @LightfootForChi in lst place comfortably, and @ToniPreckwinkle over @DaleyforMayor by about 2,600.  No one else close
author: GregHinz

text: With a third of precincts reporting, @LoriLightfoot at 16 percent, followed by @DaleyForMayor at 15 and change, and @ToniPreckwinkle just behind.  No one else close
author: GregHinz

text: Looks like #Chimayor19 may have juuuuust avoided record low.  Board telling @paschutz that it should hit 34.1% -- about 1% above the 2007 record low
author: GregHinz

text: Can't imagine this is going to be a late night, Chicago, not with turnout toying w a record low.  Only q: will it be close enough that not-yet-received mail ballots will make the diff.  #Chimayor19  @ToniPreckwinkle @DaleyForMayor @LightfootForChi
author: GregHinz

text: see....THAT'S what all those evil tats gets you :)
author: GregHinz

text: .@SenDuckworth moves to boost funding for @fly2ohare, #Create rail project.  And Georgia's @SenDavidPerdue joins in the former. Gee, what might they have in common?
author: GregHinz

author: GregHinz

text: Chicago's mayoral outcome: flip a coin.  And then cross your fingers cause we may not know for weeks who made the runoff.  @LightfootForChi @DaleyForMayor @toniforchicago @susanamendoza10 @DrWillieWilson
author: GregHinz
